title: Weird things I learned while writing an x86 emulator
dot: digraph AssemblyEmulatorTrivia{node[shape=box];A[label="x86 and amd64 Emulator Insights" shape=ellipse];B[label="Useless x86 Encoding Trivia"];C[label="Odd Flag Quirks"];D[label="Surprises with Shift Instructions"];E[label="Segment Overrides"];F[label="Segment Overrides: More Trivia"];G[label="Mentorship and Resources"];A->B;A->C;A->D;A->E;A->F;A->G;B1[label="Multiple encodings for same instruction"];B2[label="Example: int 3 = CD 03 or CC"];B3[label="EAX vs ECX encodings affect performance"];B4[label="REX prefixes in 64-bit mode"];B5[label="Address override prefix usage"];B->B1;B->B2;B->B3;B->B4;B->B5;C1[label="INC EAX vs ADD EAX, 1 affect flags differently"];C2[label="CMPXCHG modifies only zero flag"];C3[label="Undefined flags on certain instructions"];C->C1;C->C2;C->C3;D1[label="Shifting AX by 16 clears it"];D2[label="Shifting EAX by 32 does NOT clear it"];D3[label="Shift count masked against 1FH or 3FH"];D->D1;D->D2;D->D3;E1[label="Segments are used in 32-bit and 64-bit"];E2[label="FS and GS registers for TEB"];E3[label="User mode code lacks access to segment base info"];E->E1;E->E2;E->E3;F1[label="FS/GS base determined by CPU configuration"];F2[label="Different segment handling in 32-bit vs 64-bit"];F->F1;F->F2;G1[label="Mentorship from emulator experts"];G2[label="Resources: Agner Fog's website"];G->G1;G->G2;}
